Research Projects

Our research crosses multiple layers of the system stack, from hardware to programming languages and applications. Our research has four main themes. The concurrency theme addresses challenges in writing, testing and debugging concurrent programs. The approximate computing theme explores accuracy trade-offs across the system stack for better energy efficiency and performance. The emerging applications theme focuses on building systems to better support new applications, from mobile apps to graph analytics. The emerging technologies theme aims at taking advantage of new storage and compute technologies in building new systems.

Active Projects

ACCEPT

An approximate compiler for C and C++ program based on Clang.

  • luisceze

Approximate Computing

Cross-stack techniques and frameworks to safely trade-off accuracy in computation, storage and communication for better performance and energy efficiency.

  • bornholt
  • moreau
  • luisceze
  • oskin
  • djg

Biological Computing

Working at the intersection of biology and architecture, including biologically-inspired computer systems like DNA storage, and system design for next-generation bioinformatics applications.

  • kendall
  • mwillsey
  • luisceze
  • karin

Software Defined Hardware

Programming language techniques for automatically designing custom reconfigurable accelerators.

  • vlee2
  • mwillsey
  • luisceze
  • bodik

ShoeBox

Efficiently supporting multi-quality image storage

  • eqy
  • karin
  • luisceze

SNNAP

Off-the-shelf hardware acceleration for neural networks in the context of approximate computing.

  • moreau
  • wysem
  • luisceze
  • oskin

Stochastic Computing

Stochastic circuits and computing applications for low power accelerator and sensor applications.

  • vlee2
  • cowanmeg
  • luisceze
  • oskin

Real-time Virtual Reality Video

Camera rigs and custom hardware for next-generation VR/AR applications.

  • amrita
  • luisceze

Completed Projects

Aylan

In-storage processing architectural exploration for data intensive machine learning, computer vision, and data mining applications

  • vlee2
  • luisceze
  • oskin

Claret

Using Abstract Data Types to expose application-level semantics in datastores

  • luisceze
  • oskin

Disciplined Inconsistency

Helping distributed systems programmers reason about and safely trade off consistency for performance

  • bornholt
  • luisceze
  • oskin

Grappa

A runtime for providing distributed shared memory (aka PGAS) for large-scale irregular applications, leveraging latency tolerance to overcome the limitations of commodity networks.

  • luisceze
  • oskin

IncBricks

Enabling in-network computation in the datacenter network

  • mgliu
  • liangluo
  • luisceze

I/O Centric Computing

Enabling large-scale content-based searching by co-designing hardware with visual search algorithms.

  • cdel
  • vlee2
  • luisceze
  • oskin

Low-Power Face Authentication

Enabling sub-mW face detection and authentication with accelerators near image sensors.

  • amrita
  • moreau
  • sungkim
  • luisceze
  • oskin

Radish

Integrating relational query processing into high-performance parallel languages (e.g., Grappa and other PGAS)

  • oskin
